GlobalEnv.desc: Environment to run tests against the nest attributes show possible values
GlobalEnv.desc1: Set text of this node for enviroment to run tests against
GlobalEnv.desc2: Note GlobalEnv can be overridden at Project level and Finally via command line

FixtureDescriptions.desc: Attribute name is Fixture name, Attribute value is description of what fixture nodes exist under the name
FixtureDescriptions.RunDebugChromeEmu: Build Debug Mobile Device Tests, Starts Chome in mobile emulation mode
FixtureDescriptions.RunLocal-MyProAgAll: Local Run All windows 10 browsers Chrome, Firefox, Edge and IE11, Chrome Mobile Emulator iPhone X
FixtureDescriptions.RunLocal-ChromeFirefoxEdgeIE11: Local Run All windows 10 browsers Chrome, Firefox, Edge and IE11
FixtureDescriptions.RunLocal-Chrome-IE11: Most often used browsers Chrome and IE-11 local execution
FixtureDescriptions.RunMixed-Chrome-IE11: Mixed excutionMost often used browsers Local Chrome and Remote IE-11
FixtureDescriptions.RunMixed-ChromeFirefox-SafariEdgeIE11: Mixed All desktop Browsers Local Chrome Firefox, Remote Safari, Edge IE-11
FixtureDescriptions.RunAllRemoteDesktopBrws: All Remote Desktop Chrome, Firefox, IE-11, Edge and Safari
FixtureDescriptions.RunAllRemoteMyProAg1: All Remote Desktop Chrome, Firefox, IE-11, Edge and Safari. Devices ios and android

FixturesNodeName.desc: Current fixture used to execute MyProAg Tests RunAllRemoteMyProAg
FixturesNodeName.desc1: below if you remove ExampleFixEnvNmOverride- from attribute name, if GlobalEn set to qa fixture RunLocal-ChromeFirefoxEdgeIE11 vs RunDebug

PROD.desc1: Must match text value set in GlobalEnv node or OverrideEnv node

UAT.desc1: Must match text value set in GlobalEnv node or OverrideEnv node

QA.desc1: Must match text value set in GlobalEnv node or OverrideEnv node

DEV.desc: MyProAg DEV Environment URL NOT DEFINED YET
DEV.desc1: Must match text value set in GlobalEnv node or OverrideEnv node

OverrideEnv.desc: Override Global Environment to run tests against the nest attributes show possible values
OverrideEnv.desc1: If text value none no override else set text to env you wish to use override GlobalEv
OverrideEnv.desc2: note this list of attributes also states Env's that can be used for testing
OverrideEnv.desc3: See ProjecEnvUrls for possibe values, none or empty means no override
OverrideEnv.desc4: below if ExampleOverideEnvWhen- removed from attribute name, when GlobalEnv set to qa it would orverride to qa-trunk

OverrideRetryCount.desc: Number of times to retry test if test fails, currently does not include unhandled exceptions
OverrideRetryCount.desc1: none or blank means no retry

FixturesNodeName.desc: Specifies fixtures node name in AutoFixture xml file to use for execution RunAllRemoteDesktopBrws
FixturesNodeName.desc1: below if you remove ExampleFixEnvNmOverride- from attribute name, if GlobalEn set to qa fixture RunLocal-ChromeFirefoxEdgeIE11 vs RunDebug

PROD.desc1: Must match text value set in GlobalEnv node or OverrideEnv node

UAT.desc1: Must match text value set in GlobalEnv node or OverrideEnv node

QA.desc1: Must match text value set in GlobalEnv node or OverrideEnv node

DEV.desc: ProAgMapping DEV Environment URL NOT DEFINED YET
DEV.desc1: Must match text value set in GlobalEnv node or OverrideEnv node

OverrideEnv.desc1: If text value none no override else set text to env you wish to use override GlobalEv

OverrideEnv.desc3: See ProjecEnvUrls for possibe values, none or empty means no override
OverrideEnv.desc4: below if ExampleOverideEnvWhen- removed from attribute name, when GlobalEnv set to qa it would orverride to qa-trunk

OverrideRetryCount.desc: Number of times to retry test if test fails, currently does not include unhandled exceptions
OverrideRetryCount.desc1: none or blank means no retry

UAT.desc1: Must match text value set in GlobalEnv node or OverrideEnv node

QA.desc1: Must match text value set in GlobalEnv node or OverrideEnv node

OverrideEnv.desc1: If text value none no override else set text to env you wish to use override GlobalEv

FixturesNodeName.desc1: below if you remove ExampleFixEnvNmOverride- from name, if GlobalEn set to qa-trunk fixture RunLocal-ChromeFirefoxEdgeIE11 vs RunDebug

ProjectEnvUrls.desc1: Must match text value set in GlobalEnv node or OverrideEnv node

QA-Trunk-Not-Public.desc: QA-Trunk Not public Need In Win Sys32- Hosts File
QA-Trunk-Not-Public.desc1: IP and URL needed in hosts file: 172.16.106.213 qa-trunk-proagworks.com

DEV-Trunk-Not-Public.desc: DEV-Trunk Not public Need In Win Sys32- Hosts File
DEV-Trunk-Not-Public.desc1: IP and URL needed in hosts file: 172.16.106.146 dev-trunk-proagworks.com

OverrideEnv.desc: Override Global Environment to run tests against the nest attributes show possible values
OverrideEnv.desc1: If text value none no override else set text to env you wish to use override GlobalEv
OverrideEnv.desc2: note this list of attributes also states Env's that can be used for testing
OverrideEnv.desc3: See ProjecEnvUrls for possibe values, none or empty means no override
OverrideEnv.desc4: below if ExampleOverideEnvWhen- removed from attribute name, when GlobalEnv set to qa it would orverride to qa-trunk

OverrideRetryCount.desc: Number of times to retry test if test fails, currently does not include unhandled exceptions
OverrideRetryCount.desc1: none or blank means no retry

MaxWaitCreateBatchReport.desc: Create Report max wait for expected status

RemoteBuildNameOverride.desc: Use this if you need to run test session that are need for remote provicers technical support team
RemoteBuildNameOverride.desc1: Default Value is false, when true uses zTechSupport to override dynamic build naming
RemoteBuildNameOverride.desc2: zTechSupport will be ignored and not deleted you can delete session under zTechSupport when support tickets are closed
RemoteBuildNameOverride.desc3: Remeber to set name back to false once remote provider technical support sessions have be created
RemoteBuildNameOverride.name: zSetNameYouWant

RemoteBuildsRetainDays.desc: The number of days to retain build infomration
RemoteBuildsRetainDays.desc1: Any project build that is => than text value of this node will be deleted

LogToXmlRsltRollup.desc: Global turn om Create xmlLogger Rollup Logging on or off
LogToXmlRsltRollup.desc1: true Rollup Logging on, false Rollup Logging off

XmlLoggerLevels.desc: Global turn xmlLogging levels on or off
XmlLoggerLevels.desc1: true log level on, false log level off, Always on can't be turned on or off

TestRetryCount.desc: Number of times to retry test if test fails, currently does not include unhandled exceptions
TestRetryCount.desc1: value of 1 will not retry on fail 2 will retry 1 time if 1st run failed
TestRetryCount.desc2: none or blank same as value of 1 no retry

LongTimeout.desc: Find Element Long timeout in seconds

MediumTimeout.desc: Find Element Medium timeout in seconds

ShortTimeout.desc: Find Element Short timeout in seconds

ImplicitlyWaitMilliseconds.desc: Implicitly Wait in Milliseconds to use when driver created

UseCurrentDirectory.desc: Ocramaba functionality ProAg implementation always uses assembly path
UseCurrentDirectory.desc1: Gets a value indicating whether use CurrentDirectory for path where assembly files are located

GetPageSourceEnabled.desc: Gets a value indicating whether get page source is enabled. False by default

PageSourceFolder.desc: Gets the page source Relative folder key value

DownloadFolder.desc: Gets the download relative folder key value

ScreenShotFolder.desc: Gets the screen shot relative folder key value

XmlResultFolder.desc: Gets the XmlResultLog relative folder key value

FullDesktopScreenShotEnabled.desc: Gets a value indicating whether enable full desktop screen shot. False by default.

SeleniumScreenShotEnabled.desc: Gets a value indicating whether enable full selenium screen shot. True by default.

JavaScriptErrorLogging.desc: Gets a value indicating whether logs JavaScript errors from a browser. False by default.

SynchronizationWithAngularEnabled.desc: If true use perfrom wait for angular, false skip wait for angualr calls

EnableEventFiringWebDriver.desc: Gets a value indicating whether enable EventFiringWebDriver
EnableEventFiringWebDriver.desc1: EventFiringWebDriver is a class and is used to wrap your webdriver around to throw events and WebDriverEventListner is an interface which you have to implement to catch the webdriver events.
EnableEventFiringWebDriver.desc2: nlog trace level must be set to "trace" for at least one logger to see EventFiringWebDriver logs

Proxy.desc: Use if proxy needed for connecting to brtowser to internet

RemoteSiteName.desc: Set #Text to name of remote site to use, casesensitive must match node case
RemoteSiteName.desc1: Can overide this value at fixture level by adding attribute
RemoteSiteName.desc2: OverrideRemoteSiteName and set to name of other site like SauceLabs

DesktopMaxWaitStart.desc: Max time to wait for remote desktop browser driver to load

MobileMaxWaitStart.desc: Max time to wait for remote device driver to load

Browserstack.desc: settings for browserstack remote testing site

RemoteProtocol.desc: protocol to use when connecting to browserstack selenium grid http or https

RemoteUser.desc: valid user for remote connection automationuser12

RemoteKey.desc: valid key to use for remote site connection

RemoteApi.desc: Api address to set results create runs etc

DefaultsForSessions.desc: Common site settings to use when to start a session

add.desc: max time allowed between commands sent, should be greater the long timeout max 300
Mask sensitive data to written to logs, comma seperated value
Create recording of tests, true=record, false=do not record
Create selenium log of test, true=create, false=do not create
Create run with debug on, takes sceen shots for all pages, true=debug on else false
set value to errors to turn on else any other string like off
Create appium log of test if mobile device, true=create, false=do not create

RemoteProtocol.desc: Remote Site Protoocol to use http or https

RemoteUser.desc: valid user for remote connection automationuser12

RemoteKey.desc: valid key to use for remote site connection

RemoteApi.desc: Api address to set results create runs etc

UseWindowsAuth.desc: if ture use WinAuthConn else use SqlAutConn

ConnectionString.WinAuthConn: Data Source=^ServerNameHere^;Initial Catalog=^DatabaseNameHere^;Persist Security Info=True;Integrated Security=true;MultipleActiveResultSets=True;Connect Timeout=200; pooling='true'; Max Pool Size=200

SqlAuthConn.desc: Sql Auth Connection string uid and pw needed, uid and pw can be encypted

ConnectionString.SqlAuthConn: Data Source=^ServerNameHere^;Initial Catalog=^DatabaseNameHere^;Persist Security Info=True;Integrated Security=false;MultipleActiveResultSets=True;Connect Timeout=200; pooling='true'; Max Pool Size=200;uid=^SqlUserHere^;pwd=^SqlPwHere^;

SqlCmdTextTimeout.desc: Value used for CommandText.CommandTimeout, Max time to wait for a query to finish
SqlCmdTextTimeout.desc1: value is in seconds, 120 = 2 min, 138 = 2 min 30 sec, 180 = 3 min, 200 = 3 min 33 sec

EnvDbServerName.desc: Database servers and namesto use based on environment
EnvDbServerName.desc1: If DB server override needed for a particular env node add attribute with ProjectName
EnvDbServerName.desc2: For added attrbute put in server name as attribute value
EnvDbServerName.desc3: If atribute found matching project name it will override text value server name
EnvDbServerName.desc4: To override server name for a Env create attribute node with same name as project, Example ProAgWorks
EnvDbServerName.desc5: For the value of the override node add put in the server name, Example see node under qa ExampleProAgWorks
EnvDbServerName.desc6: You may also need to override DbName for a Env to do this create a attribute with ProjName and DbName on the end

ti-dev.desc: Server Name to use when environment is ti-dev

si-dev.desc: Server Name to use when environment is si-dev

dev-trunk.desc: Server Name to use when environment is dev
dev-trunk.PAWDevTrunkOverrideDesc: Override for ProAgWorks DB when running against dev-trunk

dev.desc: Server Name to use when environment is dev
dev.PAWDevTrunkOverrideDesc: Override for ProAgWorks DB when running against dev-trunk

qa-trunk.desc: Server Name to use when environment is qa

qa.desc: Server Name to use when environment is qa
qa.ExamplePAWOverrideDesc: Override for ProAgWorks DB when running against qa

ta.desc: Server Name to use when environment is testautomation

uat.desc: Server Name to use when environment is uat

trx-uat.desc: Server Name to use when environment is uat

si-uat.desc: Server Name to use when environment is uat

ti-uat.desc: Server Name to use when environment is uat

hotfix.desc: Server Name to use when environment is hotfix

si-hf.desc: Server Name to use when environment is hotfix

ti-hf.desc: Server Name to use when environment is hotfix

modeloffice.desc: Server Name to use when environment is model office

si-mo.desc: Server Name to use when environment is model office

demo.desc: Server Name to use when environment is demo

training.desc: Server Name to use when environment is training

perf.desc: Server Name to use when environment is dev

prod.desc: Server Name to use when environment is production

si-prod.desc: Server Name to use when environment is production

ti-prod.desc: Server Name to use when environment is production
